name: df-sect
params: setvar s0, setvar s1, setvar s2, setvar s3, setvar s4, setvar s5
body: |- wceq(csect, cmpt(s0, ccat, cmpo(s1, s2, cfv(cbs, cv(s0)), cfv(cbs, cv(s0)), copab(s3, s4, wsbc(s5, cfv(chom, cv(s0)), wa(wa(wcel(cv(s3), co(cv(s1), cv(s5), cv(s2))), wcel(cv(s4), co(cv(s2), cv(s5), cv(s1)))), wceq(co(cv(s4), co(cop(cv(s1), cv(s2)), cfv(cco, cv(s0)), cv(s1)), cv(s3)), cfv(cfv(ccid, cv(s0)), cv(s1)))))))))
comment: Function returning the section relation in a category. Given arrows ` f : X --> Y ` and ` g : Y --> X ` , we say ` f Sect g ` , that is, ` f ` is a section of ` g ` , if ` g o. f = 1 `` X ` . If there there is an arrow ` g ` with ` f Sect g ` , the arrow ` f ` is called a _section_, see definition 7.19 of [Adamek] p. 106. (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 2-Jan-2017.)
